availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Alfred J. Fryer (Pendleton County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, resident. Kentucky native. Married to Mary M. Heitch Fryer in Pendleton County on June 1, 1854. Father of Edwin Fryer, Mira Fryer, Mary Fryer, Sallie Fryer, Lizzie Fryer, Willie Fryer, and George Fryer. Resident in Pendleton County in 1854.

ab.bibl:
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Illinois, Clay County, Xenia Township, p. 26.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Pendleton County Marriages, Film #000272798.
Find A Grave, "Alfred J. Fryer (May 22, 1828-December 4, 1897)," Memorial #50025943, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/50025943 (accessed June 11, 2018).
